newsitem.title: SPAIN: Santander to cut share nominal to 250 pta.
newsitem.headline: Santander to cut share nominal to 250 pta.

text.p: Spanish bank Santander said on Saturday it was cutting its nominal share price from 750 pesetas to 250 pesetas in a share split next Monday.
The share split will mean that 479 million shares will be on the market against the 159.7 million quoted before the split.

Santander said its shares had increased in worth by 61 percent since the start of the year, the biggest rise among big Spanish banks, going from 8,310 pesetas per share on January 2 to 13,390 pesetas last Friday. The share price has risen 124.7 percent in the last 12 months.
The new share price, calculated by dividing the nominal price by three, will give the shares more liquidity and make them more accessible to small, retail investors, the bank said in a statement.
The share split will be done automatically and at no cost to shareholders, Santander said.
